Row.Cell: You've lost the trust of Sir Radzig.
You've lost the trust of Sir Radzig.
Without your help, Istvan won the Battle of Talmberg.
Without your help, Istvan won the Battle of Talmberg.
Without getting help, your father died.
Without getting help, your father died.
You didn't get the reinforcements to Vranik from Talmberg.
You didn't get the reinforcements to Vranik from Talmberg.
You have fallen to your death.
You have fallen to your death.
You were murdered under unforseen circumstances.
You were murdered under unforseen circumstances.
You have died by your own hand.
You have died by your own hand.
You've been hit by a stray Cuman arrow.
You've been hit by a stray Cuman arrow.
Robard is really angry at you right now.
Robard is really angry at you right now.
Zmola killed you while you were unconscious.
Zmola killed you while you were unconscious.
Young Lord Capon died while attempting to rescue the hostages.
Young Lord Capon died while attempting to rescue the hostages.
You've been kicked out of the Bailiff's service for incompetence.
You've been kicked out of the Bailiff's service for incompetence.
Capon lost 5 pints of blood. His goose is cooked.
Capon lost 5 pints of blood. His goose is cooked.

Murdering a servant of God is a most heinous crime! You tried to flee, but they soon caught up with you. Sir Radzig turned his back on you and you were hanged for your crime. Johanka was convicted of heresy and died as a result of her punishment.

Murdering a servant of God is a most heinous crime! You tried to flee, but they soon caught up with you. Sir Radzig turned his back on you and you were hanged for your crime. Johanka was convicted of heresy and died as a result of her punishment.
You were seen killing the Inquisitor and the law soon caught up with you. Sir Radzig turned his back on you and you were hanged for your crime.
You were seen killing the Inquisitor and the law soon caught up with you. Sir Radzig turned his back on you and you were hanged for your crime.
You died after your tongue was cut out for heretical speeches. Johanka was also convicted of heresy and suffered the same fate.
You died after your tongue was cut out for heretical speeches. Johanka was also convicted of heresy and suffered the same fate.
A village lad like you has no chance of defeating the fearsome Cumans. Better to run and save your skin.
A village lad like you has no chance of defeating the fearsome Cumans. Better to run and save your skin.
You were hit by a stray Cuman arrow and died while trying to flee.
You were hit by a stray Cuman arrow and died while trying to flee.
You've been executed for your grave crimes. May God have mercy on your sinful soul.
You've been executed for your grave crimes. May God have mercy on your sinful soul.

Travelling the roads in the province is hazardous - merchants are afraid even to stick their noses out of the inns, visiting relatives in neighbouring villages is a life or death gamble and folk living in remote farmsteads sleep with axes under their pillows. Behind any oak or ash along the wayside, there may be a ruthless bandit lying in wait, or even a poor student, who has drunk away his last Groschen and entered the spirit of these lawless times. Either way, the victim is lucky to lose only his purse, and not his head.

Travelling the roads in the province is hazardous - merchants are afraid even to stick their noses out of the inns, visiting relatives in neighbouring villages is a life or death gamble and folk living in remote farmsteads sleep with axes under their pillows. Behind any oak or ash along the wayside, there may be a ruthless bandit lying in wait, or even a poor student, who has drunk away his last Groschen and entered the spirit of these lawless times. Either way, the victim is lucky to lose only his purse, and not his head.

You can start dealing with the danger on the roads by talking to Sir Radzig after completing the main quest <font color='#B8AE7E'>Baptism of Fire</font>. Shortly after this point in the story, Sir Radzig will be found at the viewing point over Talmberg, and later at Pirkstein Castle in Rattay. If you're not sure where to find him, look for the <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlc3Overlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' > icon. This assignment may be temporarily unavailable during the military operations towards the end of the main storyline, or may halt progress in the story for a while.

You can start dealing with the danger on the roads by talking to Sir Radzig after completing the main quest <font color='#B8AE7E'>Baptism of Fire</font>. Shortly after this point in the story, Sir Radzig will be found at the viewing point over Talmberg, and later at Pirkstein Castle in Rattay. If you're not sure where to find him, look for the <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlc3Overlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' > icon. This assignment may be temporarily unavailable during the military operations towards the end of the main storyline, or may halt progress in the story for a while.

Travelling the roads in the province is hazardous - merchants are afraid even to stick their noses out of the inns, visiting relatives in neighbouring villages is a life or death gamble and folk living in remote farmsteads sleep with axes under their pillows. Behind any oak or ash along the wayside, there may be a ruthless bandit lying in wait, or even a poor student, who has drunk away his last Groschen and entered the spirit of these lawless times. Either way, the victim is lucky to lose only his purse, and not his head.

Travelling the roads in the province is hazardous - merchants are afraid even to stick their noses out of the inns, visiting relatives in neighbouring villages is a life or death gamble and folk living in remote farmsteads sleep with axes under their pillows. Behind any oak or ash along the wayside, there may be a ruthless bandit lying in wait, or even a poor student, who has drunk away his last Groschen and entered the spirit of these lawless times. Either way, the victim is lucky to lose only his purse, and not his head.

You can see Sir Radzig and begin dealing with the dangers lurking on the provincial roads. He can usually be found at Pirkstein Castle in Rattay. If you're not sure where to find him, look for the<img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlc3Overlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' > icon. This assignment may be temporarily unavailable during the military operations towards the end of the main storyline, or may halt progress in the story for a while.

You can see Sir Radzig and begin dealing with the dangers lurking on the provincial roads. He can usually be found at Pirkstein Castle in Rattay. If you're not sure where to find him, look for the <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlc3Overlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' > icon. This assignment may be temporarily unavailable during the military operations towards the end of the main storyline, or may halt progress in the story for a while.
Once she goes into Skalitz, Theresa can't continue to pursue side quests and won't be able to save the survivors outside.
Once she goes into Skalitz, Theresa can't continue to pursue side quests and won't be able to save the survivors outside.
You blacked out and have no idea how you got here.
You blacked out and have no idea how you got here.
There's no time. You're under attack!
There's no time. You're under attack!
You abandoned your lord and he died. For that you'll swing on the gallows.
You abandoned your lord and he died. For that you'll swing on the gallows.
Take off the clothes and get into the bath.
Take off the clothes and get into the bath.

A certain robber baron by the name of Wolflin of Kamberk has been pillaging farms in the fiefdom of Rattay with his band of renegades. The Lord of Rattay, Sir Hanush, takes a very dim view of his estates being ransacked, and so he's sent out a punitive expedition to deal with the outlaws. You are to take part.

A certain robber baron by the name of Wolflin of Kamberg has been pillaging farms in the fiefdom of Rattay with his band of renegades. The Lord of Rattay, Sir Hanush, takes a very dim view of his estates being ransacked, and so he's sent out a punitive expedition to deal with the outlaws. You are to take part.

Your corps is about to attack Wolflin's encampment. It will be a tough battle, because the enemy is expecting you and your forces are more or less matched. Arm yourself well and may God guide your hand!

Your corps is about to attack Wolflin's encampment. It will be a tough battle, because the enemy is expecting you and your forces are more or less matched. Arm yourself well and may God guide your hand!

There seem to be no end to the frivolous pursuits of young Sir Hans Capon. Recently, Sir Hans declared that before he could be bothered to do anything else he needs to solve “a particularly delicate matter of great urgency”.
There's never a dull moment with the bold Sir Hans Capon. Before he can proceed with his knightly duties, he wants me to help him with a certain delicate matter of great urgency.

The beginning of a new adventure with Sir Hans is active at the end of the Capon quest line, culminating in the <font color='#B8AE7E'>Raubritter</font> assigment, which can be started after the main quest <font color='#B8AE7E'>Questions and Answers.</font> Capon, however, has no time for amorous adventures during the battles towards the end of the game, so you won't be able to accept the quest from him until the very end, when Sir Hans goes to the camp at Neuhof. If you're not sure where to find him, look for the <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlc2Overlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' > icon.

The beginning of a new adventure with Sir Hans is active at the end of the Capon quest line, culminating in the <font color='#B8AE7E'>Robber Baron</font> assigment, which can be started after the main quest <font color='#B8AE7E'>Questions and Answers.</font> Capon, however, has no time for amorous adventures during the battles towards the end of the game, so you won't be able to accept the quest from him until the very end, when Sir Hans arrives at the camp by Neuhof. If you're not sure where to find him, look for the <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlc2Overlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' > icon.

The beginning of a new adventure with Sir Hans is now active. All you have to do is go and talk to him. Capon, however, has no time for amorous adventures during the battles towards the end of the game, so you won't be able to accept the quest from him until the very end, when Sir Hans goes to the camp at Neuhof. If you're not sure where to find him, look for the <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlc2Overlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' > icon.

The beginning of a new adventure with Sir Hans is now active. All you have to do is go and talk to him. Capon, however, has no time for amorous adventures during the battles towards the end of the game, so you won't be able to accept the quest from him until the very end, when Sir Hans goes to the camp at Neuhof. If you're not sure where to find him, look for the <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlc2Overlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' > icon.

He was rather vague about the details, but there can be little doubt that a damsel is involved. After all, who could forget what happened last time at the bathhouse…? What other mischief would lead the bold Sir Hans to neglect his responsibilities?

Knowing that Sir Hans has somewhat different priorities than the other local lords, it wouldn't be unreasonable to assume that a damsel is involved. After our last dramatic adventure at the bathhouse, I'm curious - and more than a little apprehensive - as to what his latest escapade will be all about.
It is a universally acknowledged truth that the heir to the town of Rattay – young Lord Capon – is an incorrigible womanizer who’s not satisfied with his frequent visits to the bathhouse.

Wicked tongues say the heir to the Town of Rattay, young Sir Hans Capon, is an incorrigible seducer and whore-monger. A more charitable view is that he's just looking for love. The kind you can't buy at the bathhouse...
You know the heir to the town of Rattay well enough to know that Lord Capon is an incorrigible womanizer who’s not satisfied with his frequent visits to the bathhouse.

You know the heir to the Town of Rattay, young Sir Hans Capon, well enough to realise that there's more than a little truth to the rumours that he's an incorrigible seducer and whore-monger. But then again, maybe he's just looking for love. The kind you can't buy at the bathhouse...

You and Lord Capon haven’t made acquaintance yet, but once you do, you are going to have a role to play in his amorous adventures. You, a common blacksmith’s boy, are going to be a lord’s herald, a messenger of his noble love!

You have yet to make the acquaintance of the bold Sir Hans Capon, but once you do, be prepared to get drawn into his amorous adventures. You, a common blacksmith's son, will become His Lordship's herald, his messenger of love!
In your bones you feel that that if you could get to know him better, you could play a role in his latest amorous adventure. The role of a lord’s herald, a messenger of his noble love!
You have a feeling that if you knew him better, you are very likely to get drawn into his amorous adventures. His Lordship's herald, his messenger of love - it has a ring to it!

Sir Hans Capon, the rightful heir to the Town of Rattay, dedicates most of his time to educating himself in matters knightly. He excels at hunting, combat and horseriding... or so he believes. He hasn't mastered the nobel game of chess, or even the more common game of dice, and as for poetry recitation, the time has come for him to work on that, if he's to win the heart of the maiden of his dreams.

Sir Hans Capon, the rightful heir to the Town of Rattay, dedicates most of his time to educating himself in matters knightly. He excels at hunting, combat and horseriding... or so he believes. He hasn't mastered the nobel game of chess, or even the more common game of dice, and as for poetry recitation, the time has come for him to work on that, if he's to win the heart of the maiden of his dreams.

The black clouds of strife are gathering, the thundering drums of war rumble across the land, the kingdom waits with bated breath for the lightning to strike. Not sir Hanush, though. Always an enterprising man, he decided to hold tourneys for his men to hone their martial skills and for his subjects to ease their mind.

Black clouds of strife are gathering, the thundering drums of war rumble across the land and the whole kingdom awaits the next lightning bolt with bated breath. Not so the undaunted Sir Hanush, who decided to bolster morale with a regular tourney to keep his subjects fighting fit and distract them from the pervasive gloom.

The tourney takes place every few days in Rattay near the upper castle. All weapons are allowed, as well as contestants from all stations of life – even a lowborn, good-for-nothing misfit like Henry. Just ask sir Hans Capon to make the proper introductions.

The tourney takes place every few days by the Upper Castle in Rattay. All types of melee weapons are permitted, and the contest is open to combatants from all walks of life, even a lowborn, uneducated misfit like you. Just go and ask Sir Hans Capon about it and he'll tell you all you need to know.

The black clouds of strife are gathering, the thundering drums of war rumble across the land, the kingdom waits with bated breath for the lightning to strike. Not sir Hanush, though. Always an enterprising man, he decided to hold tourneys for his men to hone their martial skills and for his subjects to ease their mind.

Black clouds of strife are gathering, the thundering drums of war rumble across the land and the whole kingdom awaits the next lightning bolt with bated breath. Not so the undaunted Sir Hanush, who decided to bolster morale with a regular tourney to keep his subjects fighting fit and distract them from the pervasive gloom.

The tourney takes place every few days in Rattay near the upper castle. All weapons are allowed, as well as contestants from all stations of life – even a lowborn, good-for-nothing misfit like Henry. Just ask sir Hans Capon to make the proper introductions. Of course, you will have to get to know him better first.

The tourney takes place every few days by the Upper Castle in Rattay. All types of melee weapons are permitted, and the contest is open to combatants from all walks of life, even a lowborn, uneducated misfit like you. Young Sir Hans Capon will tell you all you need to know about it. Once you've become better acquainted with him, that is.

The tournament convened by Sir Hanush takes place once every seven days at Rattay Upper Castle. The aim of the tourney is to test the skill of combatants will all kinds of weapons. It's intended for commoners, so you can enrol too.

The tournament convened by Sir Hanush takes place once every seven days at Rattay Upper Castle. The aim of the tourney is to test the skill of combatants will all kinds of weapons. It's intended for commoners, so you can enrol too.

After completing the side quest <font color='#B8AE7E'>Next to Godliness</font> with Sir Hans, you can accept a new quest from him, which will launch an instance of the regular tournament. If you're not sure where to find him, look for the <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlcTournamentOverlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' > icon. If you've already progressed in the storyline as far as <font color='#B8AE7E'>Epilogue</font>, you won't be able to accept the quest from Capon and the Tournament will launch on its own. the tournament will not take place while Sir Hanush is at war.

After completing the side quest <font color='#B8AE7E'>Next to Godliness</font> with Sir Hans, you can accept a new quest from him, which will launch an instance of the regular tournament. If you're not sure where to find him, look for the <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlcTournamentOverlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' > icon. If you've already progressed in the storyline as far as <font color='#B8AE7E'>Epilogue</font>, you won't be able to accept the quest from Capon and the Tournament will launch on its own. the tournament will not take place while Sir Hanush is at war.

You can go and see Sir Hans and accept from him a new quest, which will launch a regular tournament. If you're not sure where to find Sir Hans, look for the <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlcTournamentOverlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' > icon. If you've already progressed in the storyline as far as <font color='#B8AE7E'>Epilogue</font>, you won't be able to accept the quest from Capon and the tournament will launch on its own. The tournament will not take place while Sir Hanush is at war.

You can go and see Sir Hans and accept from him a new quest, which will launch a regular tournament. If you're not sure where to find Sir Hans, look for the <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlcTournamentOverlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' > icon. If you've already progressed in the storyline as far as <font color='#B8AE7E'>Epilogue</font>, you won't be able to accept the quest from Capon and the tournament will launch on its own. The tournament will not take place while Sir Hanush is at war.

After launching the main quest <font color='#B8AE7E'>Awakening</font> in Rattay, a tournament will be automatically launched every week at Rattay Upper Castle. The tournament will not take place, however, while Sir Hanush is at war.

After launching the main quest <font color='#B8AE7E'>Awakening</font> in Rattay, a tournament will be automatically launched every week at Rattay Upper Castle. The tournament will not take place, however, while Sir Hanush is at war.

To your surprise, you've found there are some interesting papers amongst your things. Most likely they were concealed in the saddlebag of the horse you escaped from Skalitz on. It seems the men of the Talmberg garrison assumed they were yours and put them in your trunk. But how would a common blacksmith's son come by such documents? After all, you can't even read! The mysterious documents have an ancient seal that testifies to the noble and ancient origin of their author.

To your surprise, you've found there are some interesting papers amongst your things. Most likely they were concealed in the saddlebag of the horse you escaped from Skalitz on. It seems the men of the Talmberg garrison assumed they were yours and put them in your trunk. But how would a common blacksmith's son come by such documents? After all, you can't even read! The mysterious documents have an ancient seal that testifies to the noble and ancient origin of their author.

You're not able to make any sense out of their content, but, luckily for you, you're not the first one to examine them. And whoever it was that read them, that learned person created a number of simple sketches based on their content, which gave you the impression of descriptions of places where rare items of clothing and armour are hidden! You've put the papers safely away in your trunk, where they're waiting until you have time to study them more closely.

You're not able to make any sense out of their content, but, luckily for you, you're not the first one to examine them. And whoever it was that read them, that learned person created a number of simple sketches based on their content, which look like descriptions of places where rare items of clothing and armour are hidden! You've put the papers safely away in your trunk, where they're waiting until you have time to study them more closely.

A legend is circulating in the province about stashes containing magnificent Warhorse armour. Many people have searched for it, but in vain. With a little effort and the grace of God, perhaps you can succeed in finding the armour and donning it to assist you in fighting the good fight!

A legend is circulating in the province about stashes containing magnificent Warhorse armour. Many people have searched for it, but in vain. With a little effort and the grace of God, perhaps you can succeed in finding the armour and donning it to assist you in fighting the good fight!

The first part of the Warhorse armour and five treasure maps will appear in your universal trunk after launching the main quest <font color='#B8AE7E'>Awakening</font> in Rattay Mill. You can access your trunk from any home or lodgings you have in the world.

The first part of the Warhorse armour and five treasure maps will appear in your universal trunk after launching the main quest <font color='#B8AE7E'>Awakening</font> in Rattay Mill. You can access your trunk from any home or lodgings you have in the world.
The first part of the Warhorse armour and five more treasure maps are stored in your universal trunk in Rattay Mill. You can access your trunk from any home or lodgings you have in the world.
The first part of the Warhorse armour and five more treasure maps are stored in your universal trunk in Rattay Mill. You can access your trunk from any home or lodgings you have in the world.

Although you hardly ventured beyond Skalitz your whole life, now and again you heard tidings from travelling merchants and wayfarers about goings on in the outside world - the big harvest festival in Merhojed, the rebuilding of Sasau Monastery and stories about an abandoned village in the woods near Talmberg.

Although you hardly ventured beyond Skalitz your whole life, now and again you heard tidings from travelling merchants and wayfarers about goings on in the outside world - the big harvest festival in Merhojed, the rebuilding of Sasau Monastery and stories about an abandoned village in the woods near Talmberg.

That village is called Pribyslavitz, and for years it has lain in ruins. You've always been curious about it - where exactly it is, what mysteries it conceals and why no one ever went back there to live. You're determined to go there and explore the village, just as soon as you and the local lords have dealt with the bandits.

That village is called Pribyslavitz, and for years it has lain in ruins. You've always been curious about it - where exactly it is, what mysteries it conceals and why no one ever went back there to live. You're determined to go there and explore the village, just as soon as you and the local lords have dealt with the bandits.

After you and your comrades-in-arms drove the bandits out of Pribyslavitz, the village was once again left to be slowly swallowed up by the woods. A shame - before being plundered by a renegade lord, it was no doubt a sprawling, bustling hamlet, judging by the size of the ruined church there, which is all that's left as a reminder of its former prosperity.

After you and your comrades-in-arms drove the bandits out of Pribyslavitz, the village was once again left to be slowly swallowed up by the woods. A shame - before being plundered by a renegade lord, it was no doubt a sprawling, bustling hamlet, judging by the size of the ruined church there, which is all that's left as a reminder of its former prosperity.

You always wondered why the folk never went back to live there, so you were pleasantly surprised to learn that Sir Divish has plans for his former hamlet. You don't know exactly what he has in mind, but you'll be glad to have a hand in it. You're sure to find out in Talmberg what needs to be done.

You always wondered why the folk never went back to live there, so you were pleasantly surprised to learn that Sir Divish has plans for his former hamlet. You don't know exactly what he has in mind, but you'll be glad to have a hand in it. You're sure to find out in Talmberg what needs to be done.

Pribyslavitz, a sprawling, long-abandoned village, is now swallowed up by the woods. You always wondered what secrets it concealed and why the villagers never returned there, and so you were pleasantly surprised when Sir Divish told you he had plans for the old settlement.

Pribyslavitz, a sprawling, long-abandoned village, is now swallowed up by the woods. You always wondered what secrets it concealed and why the villagers never returned there, and so you were pleasantly surprised when Sir Divish told you he had plans for the old settlement.

Sir Divish enlists your help in rebuilding Pribyslavitz after the bandits have been driven out of the hamlet in the main quest <font color='#B8AE7E'>Baptism of Fire.</font> If you're not sure where to find him, look for the <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlc1Overlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' > icon. It will not be possible to temporarily resume or complete the quest during any further battles.

Sir Divish enlists your help in rebuilding Pribyslavitz after the bandits have been driven out of the hamlet in the main quest <font color='#B8AE7E'>Baptism of Fire.</font> If you're not sure where to find him, look for the <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlc1Overlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' > icon. However, you will temporarily not be able to launch or continue playing the DLC during any battle quests.

Go and see Sir Divish, who wants you to help rebuild Pribyslavitz. If you're not sure where to find him, look for the <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlc1Overlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' > icon. Bear in mind, though, that it will not be possible to temporarily resume or complete the rebuilding during any battles.

Go and see Sir Divish, who wants you to help rebuild Pribyslavitz. If you're not sure where to find him, look for the <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlc1Overlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' > icon. Bear in mind, though, that it will not be possible to temporarily resume or complete the rebuilding during any battles.
You can get a dog from Theresa at Rattay Mill, but only after launching the main quest <font color='#B8AE7E'>Awakening</font>.
You can get a dog from Theresa at Rattay Mill, but only after launching the main quest <font color='#B8AE7E'>Awakening</font>.

Theresa's story is now active. You can launch the quest line by talking to Theresa. You'll be led to her by <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlc4TheresaOverlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' >.

Theresa's story is now active. You can launch the quest line by talking to Theresa. You'll be led to her by <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlc4TheresaOverlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' >.
Theresa is now looking after a dog at Rattay Mill. She's hoping you take it over, because her uncle, Miller Peshek, doesn't like the animal. Go and see Theresa and offer to help.
Theresa is now looking after a dog at Rattay Mill. She's hoping you take it over, because her uncle, Miller Peshek, doesn't like the animal. Go and see Theresa and offer to help.

A difficult fate awaits Johanka. To find out more, go and visit her at the monastery infirmary and look for <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlc4JohankaOverlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' >

A difficult fate awaits Johanka. To find out more, go and visit her at the monastery infirmary and look for <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlc4JohankaOverlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' >

Armed with fortitude and dignity, she faces the coming days with a smile on her lips. And since God moves in mysterious ways, none of us can know the lot we shall have to bear. But it is often those of whom we least expect it who encounter an extraordinary destiny...

Armed with fortitude and dignity, she faces the coming days with a smile on her lips. And since God moves in mysterious ways, none of us can know the lot we shall have to bear. But it is often those of whom we least expect it who encounter an extraordinary destiny...

You're the son of a blacksmith, whose life centered around the forge, not farming and livestock. It's not as if you ever missed cattle or pigs, but to have a dog of your own? Now that would be nice...
You're the son of a blacksmith, whose life centred around the forge, not farming and livestock. It's not as if you ever missed cattle or pigs, but to have a dog of your own? Now that would be nice...

Theresa's story will be available to you once you launch the main quest <font color='#B8AE7E'>Awakening</font>. Then all you have to do is talk to Theresa in Rattay Mill. You'll be led to her by <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlc4TheresaOverlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' >.

Theresa's story will be available to you once you launch the main quest <font color='#B8AE7E'>Awakening</font>. Then all you have to do is talk to Theresa in Rattay Mill. You'll be led to her by <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlc4TheresaOverlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' >.

A difficult fate awaits Johanka. To find out more about it, you must have completed the side quests<font color='#B8AE7E'>Pestilence</font> and <font color='#B8AE7E'>In God's Hands</font>, whether successfully or not. You will get to <font color='#B8AE7E'>Pestilence</font> from the main quest <font color='#B8AE7E'>Questions and Answers</font>. <font color='#B8AE7E'>In God's Hands</font> is assigned to you by Johanka, who is to be found at Sasau Monastery. Once you've completed those quests, all you have to do is visit Johanka again, where you will be guided by <img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/dlc4JohankaOverlay.dds' width='38' height='38' align='baseline' vspace='-8' >.

Too many of your men have died.
Too many of your men have died.

The beginning of the 15th century was a time of turmoil in the Holy Roman Empire, which had blossomed during the reign of the late Emperor Charles IV, but now, with his feckless son Wenceslas on the Bohemian throne, was falling into disarray and disunity.

The early 15th century was a time of turmoil in the Holy Roman Empire, which had flourished under the late Emperor Charles IV, but now, with his son Wenceslas “the Idle“ on the Bohemian throne, was falling into disarray.

Wenceslas' idleness earned him the enmity of many Bohemian and German nobles, as well as that of his half-brother, King Sigismund of Hungary, who decided to take drastic steps to restore order to the Empire…
The King’s inactivity angered many of the nobility, as well as his half-brother, King Sigismund of Hungary, who decided to take drastic steps to restore order to the Empire…
